intro: Lepisorus maowenensis, commonly known as the Maowen wall fern, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows on rocky surfaces or in shaded forest environments, showcasing its adaptability to moist, humid conditions. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
